SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.card

Class PlayableCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.card.Card
it.polimi.ingsw.model.card.PlayableCard
Direct Known Subclasses:
GoldCard, ResourceCard, StarterCard
public abstract class PlayableCard extends Card
A playable card is a card that can be placed on the player's board. The class is abstract, as concrete cards will be ResourceCards and GoldCards.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • type

      public final Optional<Resources> type
      Card's seed. Optional to allow StarterCards to have an empty value.

    • pointsType

      public final PointsType pointsType
      Type of points assigned to the player when placing this card on the front side.
      See Also:
      • PointsType

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayableCard

      public PlayableCard(int id, Map<CornerPosition,Corner> frontCorners, Map<CornerPosition,Corner> backCorners, Resources type, PointsType pointsType)
      Parameters:
      id - unique id of the card
      frontCorners - corners on the front of the card
      backCorners - corners on the back of the card
      type - card's seed
      pointsType - type of points assignment

  • Method Details

    • enoughResources

      public boolean enoughResources(Map<Elements,Integer> playerResources, CardSide side)
      Method to verify if the player has enough resources to play the card, on the specified side.
      Parameters:
      playerResources - resources owned by the player
      side - played card side
      Returns:
      true as in default case, a card has zero resources needed

    • playSide

      public void playSide(CardSide playedSide)
      Allows a user to play a side of the card.
      Parameters:
      playedSide - card side chosen

    • getPlayedSide

      public CardSide getPlayedSide()
      playedSide's getter.
      Returns:
      null if the card has not been played yet, a CardSide otherwise

    • getFrontCorners

      public Map<CornerPosition,Corner> getFrontCorners()
      frontCorners' getter. Private final and getter with copy (instead of public) to make the map constant.
      Returns:
      (a copy of) card's front corners

    • getBackCorners

      public Map<CornerPosition,Corner> getBackCorners()
      backCorners' getter. Private final and getter with copy (instead of public) to make the map constant.

      (a copy of) card's back corners

      public Map<CornerPosition,Corner> getActiveCorners()
